actions.text: On agreeing to the Kuster (NH) amendment (A101) as modified Agreed to by recorded vote: 327 - 101 (Roll no. 346).
Kuster (NH) amendment (A101) modified by unanimous consent.
Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Kuster (NH) amendment (A101) as modified Agreed to by recorded vote: 327 - 101 (Roll no. 346).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A101) offered by Ms. Kuster (NH).

description: An amendment numbered 34 printed in Part A of House Report 116-111 to increase and decrease the defense-wide Research, Development, Test and Evaluation account by $5 million in order to support funding to develop lead-free defense electronics to ensure the defense industry can integrate cutting edge civilian technology to meet military requirements.
purpose: Amendment redirects $5 million to fund research to increase the capacity of the defense industry to produce lead-free electronics and for the defense industry to integrate cutting edge civilian technology to meet military requirements.
